Congratulations to all!

The Pennsylvania Department of Education Bureau of Special Education is hosting a webinar entitled "Together at Home: Resources for Youth and Family. It will be held on May 19th, from 5:30 PM - 8:45 PM.

Together at Home: Resources for Youth and Families is a virtual conference designed specifically for families and students to finish the school year strong. Presenters will offer twenty-minute sessions to assist with learning in a virtual environment. Several sessions have been specially designed just for students. An opening keynote by the Director of the Bureau of Special Education, Ms. Carole Clancy, will set the stage for the importance of strong family and student commitment. Marc Elliot, author and national presenter, will close the conference with an inspirational message on finding your strength.

If you are interested in participating, please visit the link below:

https://www.pattan.net/Events/Webinar/Course-2735/Events/Session-34573

Young people were drastically undercounted in the 2010 U.S Census—which missed more than 1 in 10 children under the age of five. When we fail to count children, the programs that support their well-being—such as childcare, schools, health insurance, housing, and public transportation—lose out on needed funds for the next 10 years, an entire childhood.

Please make sure to fill out your census form so that all of our children are counted. We need accurate counts to continue to help our students succeed! #PHamily

Penn Hills School District is pleased to announce that our PHHS Marching Band Director Tiffany Sozynski will be serving as a long-term substitute teacher in the Music Department at Linton MS through the end of this school year. It is anticipated that Ms. Sozynski will report to Linton MS for duty on Monday, February 3, 2020. We thank our Linton families for your patience as we navigated Pennsylvania Department of Education teacher certification regulations. Our Board of School Directors is expected to ratify Ms. Sozynski's recall from furlough when they next meet on February 26.

Additionally, we are working with representatives from River City Brass to explore a pilot program at Linton, whereby professional musicians may be able to visit our students regularly as part of an Artist in Residence program. We will continue to keep you posted.

Good morning. Due to recent events, the Penn Hills School District is modifying planned instruction today to ensure time is spent discussing safe travel practices. We ask that families support District efforts and expand on these conversations when students arrive home. Please, trust that school-facilitated conversations will be hosted by individual classroom teachers K-12 in a thoughtful and age-appropriate manner.

We know that Penn Hills has a long tradition of standing together as a community, especially in tough times. Accordingly, we ask EVERYONE to continue conveying consistent messages with all means available to encourage those who travel throughout our community to slow down and to take extreme care, especially when it's dark and when weather conditions are poor. We thank you in advance for your cooperation and commitment to keeping our kids safe.

Sincerely,
Dr Nancy Hines
